topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Community Issues and troubleshooting

body.p: If you encounter any issues when installing HPE Helion OpenStack Community, refer to the following troubleshooting tips.

li.p: If the overcloud controller is rebooted (power issue, hardware upgrade, etc.), OpenStack compute tools such as nova-list report that the VMs are in an ERROR state, rendering the overcloud unusable. To restore the overcloud to an operational state, follow the steps below:
As user root on the overcloud controller you must:
a. Run the os-refresh-config scripts:
b. Restart the mysql service:
c. Re-run the os-refresh-config scripts:
d. Restart all neutron services:

codeblock.codeph: service neutron-dhcp-agent restart service neutron-l3-agent restart service neutron-metadata-agent restart service neutron-openvswitch-agent restart service neutron-server restart

li.p: On each overcloud node, restart the neutron and nova services:

codeblock.codeph: sudo service neutron-openvswitch-agent restart sudo service nova-compute restart sudo service nova-scheduler restart sudo service nova-conductor restart

li.p: On the system on which the installer is run, the seed VM's networking is bridged onto the external LAN. If you remove HPE Helion OpenStack Community, the network bridge persists. To revert the network configuration to its pre-installation state, run the following commands as user root:

codeblock.codeph: ip addr add 192.168.185.131/16 dev eth0 scope global ip addr del 192.168.185.131/16 dev brbm ovs-vsctl del-port NIC

li.p: where

ul.li: 192.168.185.131 is the IP address on the external interface - you should replace this with your own IP address.
The baremetal bridge is always called 'brbm'

li.p: The following error has been intermittently observed on HPE ProLiant SL390s systems on which installs are being performed:

codeblock.codeph: Fatal PCI Express Device Error PCI Slot ? B00/D00/F00

li.p: To reset a system that experiences this error,

ol.li: Connect to the iLO using a web browser (https://<iLO IP address>)
Log back into the iLO after 30 seconds
Navigate to Remote Console / Remote Console
Click Power switch / Press and Hold

li.p: The BIOS must be set to the correct date and time on all systems.
On HPE ProLiant systems you can do the following:

ol.li: Power UP the server and configure the BIOS (press F9)
Set Date and Time in the BIOS, and exit confirming your selection.
Power the server off prior to installation

li.p: On many HPE systems, including HPE servers running iLO 3 firmware, the iLO time can be set to propagate to the BIOS on powerup. You should disable propagation and set the BIOS time to the correct date and time on all systems.

ol.li: Connect to the iLO using a web browser (https://<iLO IP address>)

Navigate to Network/Shared Network Port or the Network/Dedicated Network Port (Primary Time Server, Secondary Time Server, Time Zone, and Time Propagation settings are shared between all iLO Network Ports).
Follow the steps above to set the time in the BIOS

li.p: If the iLO time propagates to the BIOS, setting an incorrect time, the undercloud or overcloud may fail to initialize with the following message:
Follow the steps above to set the time in the BIOS correctly.
The following error has also been observed on the console of a baremetal system during installation when the BIOS date/time are incorrect
Follow the steps above to set the time in the BIOS correctly.
Filesystem checking on reboot is disabled by default for the seed, undercloud and overcloud nodes. We recommend periodically manually running fsck to verify filesystem integrity.
These files contain credentials for the undercloud and the overcloud; you should ensure that they are securely stored separately from the seed.

If the hp_ced_host_manager fails to start the seed, execute the command again (a failure could be the result of a race condition in libvirt).
If the undercloud controller is rebooted, you must login to it and run the following command as root:
Failure to do this will prevent subsequent reboots of the overcloud nodes.
The installation pauses 1-2 minutes loading images and pauses of 12 or more minutes building the undercloud and overcloud.
The installer script will wait for os-collect-config to complete on the seed but times out after 10 minutes of waiting.

The installer uses IPMI commands to reset nodes and change their power status. Some systems have been seen to get into a state where the Server Power status as reported by the iLO stays stuck in the "RESET" state. If this occurs, it is necessary to physically remove power from the server for 10 seconds. If the problem persists after that, contact HPE Support - there might be a defective component in the system.
If using the seed vm as your gateway (default setting), you will need to execute the following commands after you have run hp_ced_host_manager.sh on the host machine.

codeblock.codeph: MAC=$(virsh dumpxml --domain seed | grep "mac address" | head -1 | awk -F "'" '{print $2}') VM_IP=$(arp -n | grep $MAC | awk '{print $1}') ip route replace <BM_NETWORK_CIDR> dev virbr0 via $VM_IP
